children.description: The number of cores to disable instead of the number requested in NMFS register.

children.name: Power Measurement Override
children.description: Override power measurement support status reported to ME

children.name: Power Measurement

children.description: Override hardware change detection status reported to ME

children.description: Enable/Disable HSIO messaging

children.description: Enable/Disable notifying ME about DRAM initialization. (It Enables/Disables UMA functionality.)

children.name: DRAM Initialization Status

children.description: Override HECI-1 status on PCI, or let firmware decide based on ME type (auto)

children.description: Override HECI-2 status on PCI, or let firmware decide based on ME type (auto)

children.description: Override KT status on PCI, or let firmware decide based on ME type (auto)

children.description: Enable full HECI dumps in debug output

children.name: OverClocking Feature
children.description: Performance Menu for Processor and Memory.

children.name: Filter Pll
children.description: Enabled sets GPIO8 low (0) to enable the Filter PLL for high BCKL Overclocking levels.

children.name: Processor
children.description: Processor Bus Ratio Override and FIVR Override.

children.name: CLR/Ring
children.description: CLR (Ring) Overclocking Menu

children.name: Uncore
children.description: Uncore Overclocking Menu

children.name: SVID/FIVR
children.description: SVID/FIVR global controls Menu

children.name: Core Max OC Ratio
children.description: Sets the maximum OC Ratio for the CPU Core. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x10, 0x11. Range 0-80.

children.name: Core Voltage Mode
children.description: Selects between Adaptive and Override Voltage modes. In Override Mode the voltage selected will be applied over all operating frequencies. In Adaptive Mode the voltage is interpolated only in turbo mode. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x10, 0x11.

children.name: Core Voltage Override
children.description: Specifies the Override Voltage applied to the IA Core domain. This voltage is specified in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range 0-2000 mV.

children.name: Core Extra Turbo Voltage
children.description: Specifies the extra turbo voltage applied while IA Core is operating in turbo mode. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x10, 0x11. Range 0-2000 mV

children.name: Core Voltage Offset
children.description: Specifies the Offset Voltage applied to the IA Core domain. This voltage is specified in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range -500 to 500 mV

children.name: Offset Prefix
children.description: Sets the offset value as positive or negative.

children.name: CLR Max OC Ratio
children.description: This sets the maximum overclocking ratio for the CLR Domain. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11.

children.name: CLR Voltage Mode
children.description: Selects between Adaptive and Override Voltage modes. In Override Mode the voltage selected will be applied over all operating frequencies. In Adaptive Mode the voltage is interpolated only in turbo mode. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11.

children.name: CLR Voltage Override
children.description: Specifies the Override Voltage applied to the GT domain. This voltage is specified in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range 0-2000 mV

children.name: CLR Extra Turbo Voltage
children.description: Specifies the extra turbo voltage applied while GT is operating in turbo mode. Unit is in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range 0-2000 mV

children.name: CLR Voltage Offset
children.description: Specifies the Offset Voltage applied to the GT domain. This voltage is specified in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range -1000 to 1000 mV.

children.name: Offset Prefix
children.description: Sets the offset value as positive or negative.

children.name: Uncore Voltage Offset
children.description: Specifies the Offset Voltage applied to the Uncore domain. This voltage is specified in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range -1000 to 1000 mV

children.name: Offset Prefix
children.description: Sets the offset value as positive or negative.

children.name: IOA Voltage Offset
children.description: Specifies the Offset Voltage applied to the IOA domain. This voltage is specified in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range -1000 to 1000 mV

children.name: Offset Prefix
children.description: Sets the offset value as positive or negative.

children.name: IOD Voltage Offset
children.description: Specifies the Offset Voltage applied to the IOD domain. This voltage is specified in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range -1000 to 1000 mV

children.name: Offset Prefix
children.description: Sets the offset value as positive or negative.

children.name: VccIo Voltage Control
children.description: VccIo Voltage Control

children.name: SVID Support
children.description: Enable/Disable SVID. Disabling SVID disables input voltage overrides. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x13.

children.name: SVID Voltage Override
children.description: Overrides the Vccin input voltage. This controls the input voltage to the CPU and will affect all CPU domains. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x13. Range 0-2500 mV

children.name: CPU VCCin Voltage Level
children.description: Select VRD12.5 VID Value (in decimal) for CPU VCCin voltage level (Each step = 5mV) default = 1.8V = 359

children.name: FIVR Faults
children.description: Enable/Disable FIVR Faults. When FIVR faults are disabled, OVP and OCP protection mechanisms will be masked. This is a dangerous configuration and the risk of using it is assumed by the user. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x15.

children.name: FIVR Efficiency Management
children.description: FIVR efficiency management is good for power delivery efficiency, but it may be an impediment to proper power delivery control under overclocking, particularly BCLK overclocking. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x15.
